Yasir Arafat denounced an Iranian leader's call for the killing of Westerners in retaliation for Palestinian deaths in the Israeli-occupied territories. A10

Shelling in Beirut left 20 people dead and about 100 others wounded. The fighting was a setback to an Arab-sponsored mediation effort and has ended a lull that followed a cease-fire declared nine days ago. A5
Panamanians turned out to vote in large numbers after an election campaign that became the cornerstone of the American effort to oust Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega. A1
Rival factions in Soviet Georgia are resisting merger because they cannot agree on the details of their dream, such as whether Georgia should break free of the Soviet Union at once or later. A3
The attention of Soviet watchers has shifted to the Bush Administration's response to Mikhail S. Gorbachev, who is increasingly accepted as a man dedicated to reshaping East-West relations. A12
A Soviet officer visited Afghanistan last week for talks with civilian and military leaders about the mounting military strains facing the Kabul Government, the Soviet Embassy announced. A6
The more Dan Quayle travels to friendly countries and is treated with the respect accorded an American Vice President, the more his confidence grows. A8
Bolivia voted for a president and a congress. Gen. Hugo Banzer Suazo, was generally regarded as the front-runner, but none of the nine candidates were expected to win a majority. A8

A crime wave has hit Rio de Janeiro. With 17.6 murders a day, Rio has twice the murder rate of Sao Paulo, a city with twice the population. Tourism promoters assure foreigners that most of the deaths take place in the suburbs. A7
In Tokyo, Takako Doi is popular as a political personality in a society that values shy submissiveness in women. She has led the Japan Socialist Party since 1986. A4

NATIONAL A13-17, B6-7 Soviet-American co-operation on the exploration of the planets is increasing as scientists quietly take advantage of warmer political relations to arrange exchanges between the nations. A1
America's conflict over abortion is reflected in the combination of bravado and anguish experienced by women who received abortions in San Mateo, Calif., on a typical day. A1
A scientist's testimony was changed the White House's Office of Management and Budget over the scientist's protests that it diluted the urgency of his warning about global warming effects. A1
Americans' perception of rising peril is stifling technology, wasting billions of dollars and making it more difficult to contain the most serious risks, experts believe. A1
A fair profit for insurance companies is at issue now that the California Supreme Court has upheld the main provisions of a sweeping insurance-reform initiative. D1

Witnesses in the Oliver L. North trial provided testimony that is likely to be used by prosecutors against the former national security adviser, John M. Poindexter, and three other men awaiting trial. B6
Jim Wright is trying to hold on to his aura of power and influence, his own self-image as a public servant for the common man. A14
An influx of Asians on the West Coast has been met with mixed reactions. Some workers feel they have lost control of their economic destiny to Asian owners. A14

In Hilton Head, S.C., a proposal would, in effect, stop all development when traffic at any intesection gets bad enough that a motorist has to wait through more than two changes of a traffic light. A14
5 years after the Agent Orange case was settled between Vietnam veterans and the makers of the herbicide, the outcome is still being criticized by veterans and undergoing legal scrutiny. D1

WASHINGTON TALK B7 The Transportation Safety Board, despite its obscurity, plays an important role in examining every major transportation accident and recommending remedies. Congress, on the attack, is its own target REGIONAL B1-5 A fierce battle over the death penalty is expected in Albany. The vote on the issue is closer than ever before, and the lobbying on both sides has reached a pitch rarely seen. A1
Suspected of shooting an officer, a 20-year-old Manhattan man surrendered through his attorney, C. Vernon Mason, Sunday afternoon at a Harlem church. B1
A murder in the Inwood section of Manhattan has shaken the community and brought it closer together. The owner of a supermarket was shot there 12 days ago. B1

For Governor Kean, times are sour as New Jersey's budget woes increasingly define his last year in office. Politicians and scholars question whether Mr. Kean can accomplish any of his remaining goals. B1
Homeless families in the suburbs are now able to send their children to the schools of their choice under a new program by the Board of Regents to solve the disruption of children's schooling. B3
Subpoenas for commodity traders were issued by a Federal grand jury as part of a criminal investigation of trading practices on the floors of as many as four New York commodity exchanges. D1
After the ''Super Loop'' ride stopped with its cars upside down. at a carnival in Far Rockaway, eight people were rescued by firefighters at about 12:15 A.M. yesterday. B3
John Cardinal O'Connor visited the six suspects accused of assaulting a woman in Central Park last month and ''reminded them that God loves everybody, regardless of what we may have done.'' B3
